Application & Description: Delivery of chemotherapeutic drugs or gene-editing payloads directly to tumor cells, minimizing systemic toxicity .
Nanobots function as "clottocytes" for rapid, precise removal of clots and prevention of strokes or embolisms .
Automated identification and breakdown of arterial plaques causing myocardial infarction .
Direct delivery of functional genes or gene-editing reagents (e.g., CRISPR/Cas variants) to precise cell types .
In situ dissection, repair, or removal of faulty cells or micro-tissues, such as in neurological or ocular surgery .
Programmable, on-demand delivery of medication to specific cells/organs to maximize efficacy and reduce side effects .
Continuous or event-driven biosensing for biomarkers (glucose, lactate, pH, O2, DNA, proteins) at cellular/organ level .
Real-time detection/binding and neutralizing of bacteria, viruses, or toxins (e.g., in blood, CSF, or respiratory fluids) .
Autonomous or remotely guided collection of cell/tissue samples for advanced diagnostics and molecular analysis .
Nanobot-based maintenance, biofilm removal, or repair of implanted cardiovascular stents .
Continuous nanoscale biosensing to detect early biomarkers of transplant rejection .
Neurostimulators or blockers targeting specific neurons or circuits for disorders like Parkinson's or epilepsy .
Directed delivery of growth factors, stem cells, or scaffolds at wound microsites .
Local delivery of immunosuppressants to reduce side effects of systemic therapy (e.g., for lupus, MS) .
Precise ablation, cell repair, or removal of deposits in retinal or corneal disorders .
Targeted release of antibiotics or antivirals at infection sites (e.g., resistant bacteria) .
Temporary opening, crossing, and modulated drug release for CNS disease therapy .
Disruption and elimination of bacterial biofilms from implants, catheters, or chronic wounds .
Real-time monitoring and modulation of cardiac or metabolic signals for early heart failure detection .
Precision removal or repair of nephron micro-blockages to prevent or treat kidney failure .
Delivery of cytokine inhibitors or steroids at specific inflamed tissue sites .
Rapid induction of clotting at internal injury sites (trauma, surgery) .
Manipulation, removal, or repair of individual cells in situ (e.g., cancer, immune, neuronal cells) .
Fluorescent or molecular mapping of tumor borders during surgery for higher resection precision .
Targeted delivery of genetic material or repair of reproductive microenvironments .
